title-group.article-title: Public Access Week: Who could read my papers?

body.p: I did a little experiment to figure out whether the fulltext versions of my last 15 papers (published between 1997-2008) are available online. The result:

list-item.p: 10 papers only available from within my institution (Journal subscription required)

body.p: Interestingly, the papers in the two journals with the highest impact factor are both available as full-text. And the third full-text paper is my paper with the most citations (and published in 1998).
Conclusion: Not that anyone would care what I have to say, but you have to work in an institution with a good library budget to read my papers.
